title: Soya-mirin mackerel with broccoli & edamame noodles

ingredients.item: 1½ tbsp Cooks’ Ingredients Reduced Salt Light Soya Sauce
1 tsp finely grated fresh root ginger
½ small clove garlic, finely grated
2 frozen mackerel fillets, defrosted (or fresh fillets)
1 small head of broccoli, cut into florets

instructions.step: Preheat the grill to high. Mix the soya, mirin, ginger, garlic and sesame oil. Arrange the mackerel fillets, skin-side down, on a foil-lined baking tray. Spoon half the dressing over the top. Grill the fish for 3 minutes, then turn and cook skin-side up for 2 minutes.
Meanwhile, bring a large pan of water to the boil. Add the edamame beans and cook for 2 minutes. Add the broccoli and simmer for another 2 minutes, then drain.

Heat the noodles according to pack instructions and divide between plates. Top with the edamame and broccoli, and spoon over the remaining dressing. Arrange the mackerel fillets on top and scatter with the salad onions.
